metadata.title: CVE-2019-16748 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
In wolfSSL through 4.1.0, there is a missing sanity check of memoryaccesses in parsing ASN.1 certificate data while handshaking. Specifically,there is a one-byte heap-based buffer over-read in CheckCertSignature_ex inwolfcrypt/src/asn.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-16748` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwolfssl23 - 4.2.0+dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wolfssl package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.2.0+dfsg-1').
